Package arb.functions.complex

Interface SelfAdjointFunction

All Superinterfaces:
ComplexFunction, Function<Complex,Complex>
public interface SelfAdjointFunction extends ComplexFunction
A self-adjoint function (more commonly called a Hermitian function which is named after Charles Hermite) is a complex function with the property that its complex conjugate is equal to the original function with the variable changed in sign:
f^*(x)=f(-x) where f^* is the complex conjugate of f
âˆ€x in the domain of f.
In physics, this property is referred to as PT symmetry which is invariance with respect to the simultaneous action of the (P) parity-inversion and (T) time reversal symmetry operators)
f is a self-adjoint iff (if and only if) 1. the real part of f is an even function
and
2. the imaginary of f is an odd function
